summary: This document contains due diligence research results related to Richard Kahn, including searches for negative media and court cases. It discusses a class action lawsuit involving BMW of North America and provides details on the settlement agreement, including compensation for affected vehicle owners. The document also includes personal information about Richard Kahn and his family members. This document contains detailed driver and vehicle registration information for Richard Charles Kahn, including various records of his Texas driver licenses, vehicle registrations, and property assessments. It highlights multiple vehicles owned by Kahn, their registration details, and associated values. This document contains vehicle registration records associated with Richard C. Kahn, including details about various vehicles owned, lienholders, and related corporate entities. It highlights multiple registrations, liens, and business associations linked to Kahn, indicating his involvement in various business activities and ownership of multiple vehicles. This document contains various records related to Richard Kahn, including corporate affiliations, legal cases, and personal information. It highlights Kahn's involvement in multiple businesses and legal matters, including disciplinary actions and appeals in court cases. The document is primarily focused on Kahn's corporate roles and legal history. This document discusses an appeal from the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York regarding a motion to amend a complaint to add additional plaintiffs. The court found that the claims of the additional plaintiffs were time-barred and dismissed the appeal for lack of jurisdiction, as the order was not a final judgment. This document discusses the legal proceedings involving the National Independent Theatre Exhibitors, Inc. (NITE) and its president, James Thomas Patterson, Sr., regarding an antitrust case against major film distributors. The case centers on allegations that these distributors conspired to undermine NITE's Film Fund and its associated advertising program, leading to significant financial losses for NITE and its members. The court ultimately ruled against Patterson and NITE, citing a lack of standing to pursue their claims. This document discusses a legal case involving Richard Kahn as the plaintiff against BMW of North America, LLC. It details the roles of various attorneys involved in the case and the procedural aspects of litigation, including the court's ruling on the substitution of parties and the implications of corporate dissolution on ongoing litigation.

events.title: Final Approval Hearing Rescheduled
events.description: The final hearing to consider approval of the settlement reached in the class action lawsuit against BMW was rescheduled to this date.

events.title: Oral Argument on Settlement Value
events.description: Plaintiffs' counsel estimated that the total value of the settlement may exceed $30 million during oral arguments.

events.title: Richard Kahn Files Class Action
events.description: Richard Kahn filed a putative class action against BMW of North America in the Eastern District of New York.

events.title: Final Fairness Hearing Scheduled
events.description: The final fairness hearing to assess the proposed settlement was scheduled for this date.

events.title: Court Consolidation of Actions
events.description: The court consolidated the action with another similar case brought in the district.

events.title: Supreme Court Application Denied
events.description: The Supreme Court denied an application related to Richard Kahn's case.

events.title: Appeal Dismissed
events.description: An appeal by investors challenging a district court's order was dismissed for lack of jurisdiction.

events.title: Decision Without Published Opinion
events.description: The court found the case suitable for decision without oral argument and affirmed the lower court's ruling.

events.title: Original Complaint Filed
events.description: The original complaint was filed by the plaintiffs against the defendants alleging fraud.

events.title: District Court Ruling
events.description: The district court granted Chase's motion for summary judgment and denied the plaintiffs' motion to amend the complaint.

events.title: NITE Regional Meeting
events.description: Cinemavision announced the launch of the screen advertising program at a regional meeting.

events.title: Twentieth Century Fox Statement
events.description: Twentieth Century Fox issued a statement requiring exhibitors to pay a percentage of revenues from on-screen advertising.

events.title: Warner Brothers Bid Solicitation
events.description: Warner Brothers sent out bid solicitations for 'Superman,' stating that theatres exhibiting screen ads would not be eligible for licensing.

events.title: Filing of Lawsuit
events.description: Richard Kahn filed a lawsuit against BMW of North America, LLC for fraud.

events.title: Termination of Attorney
events.description: Wendy R. Stein was terminated as an attorney for Richard Kahn.

events.title: Civil Suit Filed
events.description: Bobby Donaldson filed a civil suit against ABC Company and John Doe.

keyFacts: Richard Kahn is the subject of due diligence research with no significant negative media results found.
A class action lawsuit against BMW of North America involves multiple plaintiffs alleging defects in MINI Coopers.
The total estimated value of the settlement in the class action lawsuit may exceed $30 million.
The final approval hearing for the settlement was rescheduled to July 14, 2016.
Richard Kahn filed a putative class action against BMW of North America in the Eastern District of New York.
Richard Charles Kahn has multiple vehicle registrations in Texas, including a 2012 Mercedes-Benz GLK350 and a 2011 Dodge Ram 3500.
Kahn's driver information includes records of address changes, duplicate licenses, and renewals.
The document lists various property assessments for Kahn in Webb and Bexar Counties, indicating ownership of multiple properties.
Kahn's vehicles are registered under his name with various lienholders, including JPMorgan Chase Bank and Ford Motor Credit Co.
The document contains confidential information and is marked for internal use only.
Richard C. Kahn is associated with multiple vehicle registrations and lienholders.
Cristina Madrigal is listed as a co-registrant for a vehicle with Richard C. Kahn.
Several potential relatives of Richard C. Kahn are identified, including Julia E. Kahn and Lindsey Allison Kahn.
The document includes various addresses associated with Richard C. Kahn and his business activities.
There are multiple lienholders listed for vehicles owned by Richard C. Kahn, indicating financial obligations.
Richard Kahn is involved in multiple businesses and has held various corporate titles.
There are several legal cases involving Richard Kahn, including appeals and disciplinary actions.
The document contains personal information about Richard Kahn, including addresses and phone numbers.
The plaintiffs sought to amend their complaint to add additional plaintiffs, which the court found to be time-barred.
Eric Moss, the attorney for the plaintiffs, failed to include the additional plaintiffs due to a mistake attributed to his illness.
The district court dismissed the appeal for lack of jurisdiction as the order was not a final judgment.
James Thomas Patterson, Sr. was the president of NITE and involved in the Film Fund initiative.
The MPAA committee, led by Richard Kahn, opposed NITE's advertising program, fearing it would clutter screens.
Cinemavision, which partnered with NITE, went out of business due to the pressure from major film distributors.
The court ruled that Patterson lacked standing to sue under antitrust laws as he was not directly targeted by the alleged anticompetitive behavior.
Richard Kahn is the plaintiff in a fraud lawsuit against BMW of North America, LLC.
Tina Wolfson is the lead attorney for Richard Kahn.
Wendy R. Stein was terminated from her role as an attorney for Richard Kahn.
Bobby Donaldson filed a separate civil suit against ABC Company and John Doe.
Berardi Dimarzio is the attorney representing Bobby Donaldson in his civil suit.
